[[W.H. Lewis]] | publisher=Oxford University Press (Amen House, London) | date=[[4 December]] [[1947]]{{CG|C}}, p. 326 | format=Hardback in dustwrapper | pages=145 }} '''''Essays Presented to Charles Williams''''' is a collection of six articles by friends of [[Charles Williams]], written to present to him on his leaving Oxford, but published in 1947, to honour his death in 1945. [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] contributed his "[[On Fairy-Stories]]" (pp. 38â€“89) essay, which appeared here in print for the first time. ==Contents== *[[C.S. Lewis]]: Preface *[[Dorothy Sayers]]: "'... And Telling you a Story': A Note on ''The Divine Comedy''" *[[J.R.R. Tolkien]]: "[[On Fairy-Stories]]" *[[C.S. Lewis]]: "On Stories" *[[Owen Barfield|A.O. Barfield]]: "Poetic Diction and Legal Fiction" *[[Gervase Mathew]]: "Marriage and ''Amour Courtois'' in Late-Fourteenth-Century England" *[[W.H. Lewis]]: "The Galleys of France" {{References}} {{title|italics}} [[Category:Books with contribution by J.R.R.
